maqras.text: No, I do swear by this city (Mecca)
and you are a dweller of this city
and by the begetter (father) and that which he begot (son)
We have indeed created man in hardship
Does he think that no one will ever have power over him
He says, “I have destroyed plenty of wealth.”
Does he think that no one sees him
Did We not make for him two eyes
and a tongue and two lips
and show him the two high ways (of good and evil)
But he did not attempt the uphill (road)
And what will make you realize what the uphill (road) is
Freeing a slave
or feeding during a period of hunger
an orphan having relationship
or the dusty poor
then to be among those who believe and recommend to each other patience and recommend to each other compassion
Those are the companions of the right hand (side)
And those who do not believe in Our signs, they are the companions of the left hand (side)
Fire will be closed over them (enveloping them from all sides)
By the sun and its light
and the moon when it reflects it
and the day when it unveils it
and the night when it covers it
and the sky and Him Who built it
and the earth and Him Who spread it
and the soul and Him Who balanced it
then inspired in it, its transgressions and its guarding (against evils)
He indeed succeeds who purifies it
and he indeed fails who buries it
Thamud denied (the truth) due to their rebellion
when the most wretched of them broke forth
The messenger of God told them, “It is the she-camel of God, so let her drink.”
But they denied him and slaughtered her so their Lord destroyed them due to their sin and thus balanced it (the destruction was equal to their crime)
And He does not fear its consequence
By the night when it covers (the sun)
and the day when it unveils (the sun)
and Him Who created the male and the female
Your striving is certainly for diverse ends
So as for him who gave and guarded (against evil)
and accepted that which was best
We will facilitate him for ease
And as for him who was niggardly and considered himself independent
and denied that which was best
We will facilitate him for difficulty
And his wealth will not keep him safe from difficulty when he perishes
It is certainly on Us to guide
And certainly, Ours is the latter (future) and the former (past)
So I warn you of the blazing fire
None will enter it except the wretched
who denied and turned away
And one who guards (against evil) will be saved from it
he who gives his wealth for his self purification
and he does not bestow favour on anyone, from that which is with him, (with the intention of) being rewarded (back)
but he seeks the Attention of his Lord, the High
And he will surely be pleased
By the brightness of the day
and the night when it darkens
Your Lord has neither forsaken you nor does he hate you
And surely the latter period (future) will be better for you than the former (past)
And surely you will be given (so much) by your Lord that you will be pleased
Did He not find you an orphan, then give you shelter
and find you wandering then guide you
and find you poor then make you free of want
So as for the orphan do not oppress (him)
and as for the beggar do not drive him away
and as for the favour of your Lord, do proclaim
